title: Brickmont at Roswell Ribbon Cutting
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join us in celebrating the ribbon cutting of Brickmont at Roswell 2650 Holcomb Bridge Road Alpharetta, GA 30022 Thursday, November 6th, 3pm What is Brickmont at Roswell? This senior community is nestled in a welcoming setting in Roswell, Georgia, conveniently located off Holcomb Bridge Road, near Vickery Creek Falls, Dunwoody Country Club, and the Chattahoochee Nature Center. They offer comfortable apartments, a rich collection of amenities, and a variety of daily activities and entertainment. The highly-trained and compassionate team is committed to ensuring that the residents feel loved and welcomed, backed by the best senior care available from our dedicated caregiving professionals. title: NextGen Connect & Caffeinate at Just Love Coffee & Cafe
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: Join other North Fulton young professionals for networking, coffee, and breakfast at the Greater North Futon Chamber for NextGen Connect & Caffeinate. Build relationships, invest in your own professional development, and develop leads with us. Event registration includes coffee and is open to both Chamber members and non-members. NextGen Connects is a Chamber talent development initiative that serves to engage, recognize, and develop the Greater North Fulton Chamber of Commerce’s future leaders. This young professionals group is designed for individuals, ages 21 to 40, who are living and/or working in North Fulton. Interested in sponsoring or hosting a NextGen Connect & Caffeinate or After Hours event? ﻿Contact Christy Hulsey to invest in North Fulton's future today: chulsey@gnfcc.com Events News Sponsorship Opportunities Join Membership Levels Member Benefits Member Directory

title: ProAlliance Networking Meeting
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: You are invited to be a part of one of the largest networking groups in North Fulton. Build relationships, support professional development, and develop leads. This is an opportunity to network with other Chamber members and guests, share ideas, and grow your business. What to Expect: - Be prepared to speak for ~2 minutes to share more about yourself in a small group setting - Enjoy 6-minute presentations from two GNFCC members (all Chamber Members are eligible) - Be prepared to stand and give a ~25 second elevator pitch to all guests - Opportunity to donate swag items to giveaway to the crowd (simply bring item with you and give to facilitator) Please register by 4pm on the Tuesday prior to the meeting prior to be on the registration list. You may register until the start of the meeting at 7:30am. Registration is required for this event. ProAlliance Coffee Sponsor: 7:30am - 7:45am - Networking 7:45am - Meeting Begins 9:00am – Meeting Concludes Events News

title: Strategic Leadership Visit
location: 10000 Avalon Blvd., Suite 100 Alpharetta, GA 30009, USA
description: The Greater North Fulton Chamber’s Strategic Leadership Visit brings together 40 top leaders from government, business, and education to explore bold ideas and breakthrough initiatives driving success in other communities. Designed to spark collaboration and inspire action, this high-impact trip fosters powerful connections among North Fulton and metro Atlanta leaders—laying the groundwork for transformative progress back home. We will be exploring the cities of Scottsdale and Mesa, Arizona- cities known for their innovative approaches to economic development, regional collaboration, smart infrastructure, and arts and tourism investment. This fast-growing, future-focused area offers valuable insights and inspiration as North Fulton continues to shape its own path forward. title: Arbor Day
description: The community’s Annual Arbor Day Celebration is Friday, February 20 at 10 a.m. at Elachee Nature Science Center . Open to the public, the event is coordinated by the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce and sponsored by the Hall County Master Gardeners , Keep Hall Beautiful and Georgia Power . Festivities include student contest recognition and a joint City of Gainesville/Hall County proclamation with Tree City USA recognition. The Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce Beautification Committee and the Georgia Forestry Service will recognize winners of the 2026 Arbor Day Student Art and Essay Contest. Dozens of student art and essay entries were submitted with the topic “I Speak for the Trees.” For information on Arbor Day or other Greater Hall Chamber Community Development programs, including Agribusiness programs and Business & Residential Beautification Awards, contact Robin Halstead, Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce, 770-532-6206 x 101. Email: rhalstead@ghcc.com 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Business Showcase 2026
description: Business Showcase Tuesday, February 24, 2026 2:00 - 5:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center REGISTER HERE Discover the heartbeat of our local economy at the Business Showcase , where businesses from across the region come together to highlight their products, services, and innovations. Whether you're a fellow business owner, a professional looking to expand your network, or a curious community member, this event is your chance to engage directly with local businesses and entrepreneurs. Browse booths, make connections, and see what makes our local business community thrive. Then stick around for the Showcase Social from 5–7 PM to keep the conversations going over food, drinks, and good company! Please Note: All booths that remain set up throughout Showcase Social will be entered to win a full refund for their booth Chamber Member Exhibit $350 Non-Member $550 A ttendance is FREE and OPEN TO THE PUBLIC Showcase Social Tuesday, February 24, 2026 5:00 - 7:00 PM Gainesville Civic Center REGISTER HERE Stick around (or join us!) for the Showcase Social —an evening of tasting, toasting, and networking . title: Farm City Breakfast
location: 4175 Nopone Rd Gainesville ,
description: Farm City Breakfast Tuesday November 18, 2025 7:30am North Hall Community Center This event highlights agribusiness is the Hall County area and is a partnership between the UGA/Hall County Extension, Georgia Farm Bureau and the Greater Hall Chamber of Commerce. This years special guest is Anthony (Tony) Llano- Director, Industry Partnerships & Project-Based Learning University of Georgia College of Agricultural & Environmental Sciences (CAES). Mr. Llano will be talking about UGA's Grand Farm; a working innovation farm. The 250-acre site will be a hub for agricultural innovation projects, demonstrating new technologies and automation focused on specialty crops from Georgia and the Southeast. The first projects are set to go live this year. To register for this event please call Karen Davis at the Hall County Extension office at 770-535-8293 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Hackers Holiday Golf Tournament 2026
description: Check back for more information and registration early 2026! $250 Individual Player $900 Foursome Team 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Registered Hands Only: Why Credentials Matter in Medical Imaging"
description: J oin Erika Bongart with Lanier Technical College to learn more about Radiology Technologist and why their role is so important to healthcare. About the presentation : Medical imaging is a vital part of diagnosing everything from broken bones to cancer…but not all imaging is equal. This presentation shines a light on the essential role of Registered Radiologic Technologists, who are Nationally certified experts in safely and accurately producing medical images. Learn how their training in anatomy, radiation safety, and technology ensures the highest standard of care. This presentation explores why choosing credentialed professionals protects patients and supports accurate diagnoses—because when it comes to your health, who takes your image matters. About the speaker : Erika Bongart is a Registered Radiologic Technologist and the Program Director for the Radiologic Technology Associate Degree program at Lanier Technical College. Erika been a member of the Lanier Technical College faculty since 2019, and specializes in pediatric medical imaging. Erika is a proud alumnus of LTC, where she earned an Associate of Applied Science degree in Radiologic Technology. She was awarded a Bachelo

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - “When Caregiving Gets Legal: What Families Need to Know Before It’s Too Late”
description: Join Josh Nelson with Nelson Elder Care Law to discuss "When Caregiving Gets Legal: What Families Need to Know Before It’s Too Late". Presentation Bio: Caring for an aging parent or loved one is more than just doctor visits and daily support; it often means stepping into unexpected legal territory. Having the right legal tools can make the difference between smooth decision-making and costly court battles. In this session, Josh Nelson will share practical insights on the legal tools every caregiver should have in place and how families can avoid the most common pitfalls. Speaker Bio: Josh Nelson, JD, is the CEO and Owner of Nelson Elder Care Law. With advanced training in both law and taxation, he has spent over a decade helping Georgia families protect their loved ones and their assets during life’s most difficult transitions. Since founding his firm in 2014, Josh has guided more than 7,000 families through the legal and financial challenges of caring for aging parents. As Vice Chair of the Elder Law Section of the State Bar of Georgia, he frequently speaks to caregivers, professionals, and community groups about the practical steps families can take to reduce stress, prevent cris

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - Why Everyone Should Care about Hospice & The region's first Hospice House
description: Hospice of Northeast Georgia Medical Center (NGMC) is changing the way our community understands end-of-life care — from home-based hospice to the region’s first freestanding Hospice House, now under construction in Gainesville. As a Level 5 We Honor Veterans Partner and recipient of the Hospice Honors Elite award (placing it among the nation’s top 5% of hospices), Hospice of NGMC is built on a promise: compassionate, patient-centered care for everyone, regardless of ability to pay. In this presentation, Dr. Mary Keith will explain what hospice and palliative care truly mean, why these services matter long before the final days, and how NGMC’s expanding programs — including the upcoming Hospice House — offer peace, comfort and connection for patients and families. If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206

title: Health & Wellness Seminar - “Your Best Foot Forward”
description: The seminar “Putting Your Best Foot Forward” offers a comprehensive exploration of foot and ankle health, focusing on the critical role of proper footwear and accessories in preventing and managing injuries, particularly for runners. Big Peach Running Co. - Braseton has partnered with Peachtree Orthopedics to host this event. Attendees will gain insights into the importance of quality, well-fitted shoes and the specialized designs behind them, tailored to support foot and ankle health. Dr. Connor Murphy, a fellowship trained Orthopedic Foot & Ankle surgeon, will discuss common running injuries, their causes, and how custom orthotics, inserts, socks, and other durable medical equipment can address specific foot and ankle pathologies. Experts from Big Peach - Braselton will also highlight the benefits of a professional shoe fit process, ensuring participants leave equipped with practical knowledge to optimize their footwear choices and enhance overall mobility and comfort. Ryan Kyranakis If you would like to attend on zoom, please register via the registration button. An email will be sent prior to the seminar with a zoom link. 230 E.E. title: Marketing Workshop 2026
description: Marketing Workshop 2026 Wednesday, January 21, 2026 8:30 - 10:30 AM Brenau Downtown Center 301 Main Street, Gainesville, GA Finding Your Voice: How Brands Stay Authentic in an AI World When artificial intelligence can generate content, automate campaigns, and predict consumer behavior, what keeps your brand truly unique? The team at Forum Communications will discuss how organizations can maintain a consistent, authentic brand presence in an AI-driven environment. They’ll discuss the intersection of storytelling, digital and traditional marketing tactics, and the importance of building a voice that is unmistakably human, no matter the platform or technology. Attendees will walk away with practical insights on balancing automation with authenticity, using AI in efficient and practical ways, and ensuring their brand stands out as real, relatable, and relevant in an ever-crowded (and noisy) marketplace. title: South Hall Business Coalition - King's Hawaiian
location: 00 AM 5425 Aloha Way Flowery Branch,
description: King's Hawaiian Thursday, April 21 9:00 - 10:00 AM 5425 Aloha Way Flowery Branch, GA 30542 Join us for an update and tour of the King's Hawaiian Bakery in South Hall County, where their flagship product, Hawaiian sweet bread, is produced. Tour attendees will see a state-of-the-art facility and learn what it takes to produce the irresistible sweet rolls from start to finish. Founded in 1955, the company has grown from a small bakery operation in Hawaii, to a distribution company selling bread, rolls, and pretzels bites nationwide. The family-owned food company expanded its Oakwood facility, creating more than 160 new jobs. This new 150,000-square-foot bakery is located across the street from the King's Hawaiian facility in Oakwood South Industrial Park. King's Hawaiian opened in Oakwood in 2010, and today provides over 800 jobs for the Hall County community. **Please note: space is LIMITED. Max 3 people per organization** REGISTER HERE $8.00 Member $15.00 Non-Member Light breakfast included 230 E.E. Butler Parkway Gainesville, GA 30501 | Phone: (770) 532-6206
